de.sub.goobi.helper

Class ShellScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.helper.ShellScript

  • public class ShellScript
extends Object
    The class ShellScript is intended to run shell scripts (or other system commands).
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

      • run

        public int run()
        throws IOException
        The function run() will execute the system command. This is a shorthand to run the script without arguments.
        Returns:
        the exit value of the script
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • run

        public int run(List<String> args)
        throws IOException
        The function run() will execute the system command. First, the call sequence is created, including the parameters passed to run(). Then, the underlying OS is contacted to run the command. Afterwards, the results are being processed and stored.

        On interrupt request, the function will continue waiting for the script and then set interrupted state again to allow the executing thread to exit gracefully where defined.

        The behaviour is slightly different from the legacy callShell2() command, as it returns the error level as reported from the system process. Use this to get the old behaviour: 

         Integer err = scr.run(args);
 if (scr.getStdErr().size() > 0)
     err = ShellScript.ERRORLEVEL_ERROR;
        Parameters:
        args - A list of arguments passed to the script. May be null.
        Returns:
        the exit value of the script
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      • inputStreamToLinkedList

        public static LinkedList<String> inputStreamToLinkedList(InputStream myInputStream)
        The function inputStreamToLinkedList() reads an InputStream and returns it as a LinkedList.
        Parameters:
        myInputStream - Stream to convert
        Returns:
        A linked list holding the single lines.

      • legacyCallShell2

        public static int legacyCallShell2(String nonSpacesafeScriptingCommand)
                            throws IOException
        This implements the legacy Helper.callShell2() command. This is subject to whitespace problems and is maintained here for backward compatibility only. Please don’t use.
        Parameters:
        nonSpacesafeScriptingCommand - A single line command which mustn’t contain parameters containing white spaces.
        Returns:
        error level on success, 1 if an error occurs
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error happens
